meanings.definition: To be overwhelmed or shocked by a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunder deaved the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: She deaved when the fire alarm suddenly went off.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected car horn deaved the sleeping cat, making it jump.
meanings.sent4: The explosion deaved the entire neighborhood, causing windows to rattle.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks deaved the young child, leaving him wide-eyed in amazement.

meanings.sent1: The complex math problem deaved the students in the class.
meanings.sent2: He deaved after getting lost in the maze of hallways.
meanings.sent3: The sudden change in plans deaved her, making her forget what she was doing.
meanings.sent4: The conflicting instructions deaved the poor robot, causing it to malfunction.
meanings.sent5: The new language deaved him, leaving him struggling to understand the words.

meanings.sent1: The loud bang deaved the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent2: She deaved when a spider suddenly crawled on her arm.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie deaved him, making him jump in his seat.
meanings.sent4: The ghostly figure deaved the explorers in the dark cave.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected noise deaved the little child, causing tears to well up in his eyes.
